channel.title: Posts on Jim Mitchell
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jim Mitchell

item.title: The Day I Met Martin Mull... Sort Of
item.description: Hearing of the passing of Martin Mull reminded me of the time that I sort of met him quite by accident. What struck me was that he was exactly the same person I’d seen on TV so many times.

item.title: Pour One Out for Henry
item.description: It’s always jarring to learn of someone you knew passing away.

item.title: MacBook Air M3 15" First Impressions
item.description: My initial thoughts on the MacBook Air M3 15" fully specd model…

item.title: On the Fragility of Life
item.description: Events happen in our lives that make us do a full stop and give a long, hard look at how things are.

item.title: My 2023 Mac Apps of the Year
item.description: My list of the top five Mac apps I used in the past year that made my work easier.

item.title: Tinylytics for Micro.blog v3.1.0
item.description: Yet another update to Tinylytics for Micro.blog

item.title: My App Defaults
item.description: I wasn’t going to do a post like this… But what the heck, all the cool kids are doing it this week, so why shouldn’t I, right?

item.title: Tinylytics for Micro.blog 3.0 Released
item.description: Another major update for Tinylytics for Micro.blog…

item.title: Tinylytics for Micro.blog v2.1 Released
item.description: Even more Tinylytics for Micro.blog updates…

item.title: Tinylytics for Micro.blog 2.0 Release
item.description: More Tinylytics for Micro.blog updates…

item.title: Tinylytics for Micro Blog Updated to 1.0.6
item.description: Some Tinylytics for Micro.blog updates

item.title: New Plugin Tinylytics for Micro Blog
item.description: I published my very first Micro.blog plugin today.

item.title: Better Applescript Compress Files or Folders
item.description: I created an AppleScript that allows you to compress files and folders by simply dropping them onto the applet. A reader asked for a way to archive files and folders based off that post. This was my solution.

item.title: Seeing the Forest for the Trees
item.description: No matter how well-intentioned we are, sometimes we allow things to sneak into our lives under the guise of it being something important.

item.title: The Ant Mound
item.description: Though it didn’t turn out to be the end of the world, it sure seemed like a living hell when it happened.

item.title: Memorable Cigarettes
item.description: I used to smoke a long time ago. It’s not something I’m proud of, but it is part of who I am. These are a few memories tied to a nasty habit I was able to break.

item.title: Start Somewhere
item.description: Eventually you use up every excuse in your book for not doing the thing you keep saying you’re going to do.

item.title: Eliminating Digital Distractions
item.description: Life is so full of distractions. It seems everything is vying for our attention in one way or another these days, with most of it coming from our electronic gadgets.

item.title: The Spin Cycle
item.description: We move from one thing to the next and then another in search of a quick thrill, because we’ve become instant gratification junkies.

item.title: Saying No
item.description: Saying no can be one of the hardest things we can do for ourselves.

item.title: Applescript to Compress Files and Folders
item.description: This Applescript compresses files and folders into their own archive.

item.title: AppleScript to Add Files in the Mac Finder
item.description: I had the need to add several named text files to a project folder in the Finder on my Mac today. This is the AppleScript I developed to solve it.

item.title: Applescript to Toggle the Desktop
item.description: An AppleScript I use to quickly toggle desktop visibility for taking screenshots and recording screencasts that I thought might be useful for others.

item.title: Rebuilding the Apple Mail Envelope Index
item.description: I’m one of those guys who likes to have everything all in one place at my finger tips when I need it. But something wasn’t quite right.
